title: MH370: Could missing Malaysian Airlines plane finally be found?

title: New Omicron variant: Are low vaccination rates in South Africa a factor?
description: Has the slow rollout of vaccines in southern Africa allowed coronavirus mutations to develop?

title: Ben Brereton Diaz: Fan's belly tattoo of striker leads to fame in Chile
description: Lewis Hamill says his life has been "mad" since his tattoo of Ben Brereton Diaz was posted online.

description: The new variant threatens to overshadow the holiday season as campaigners fight vaccine fears.

title: Obituary: Sir Antony Sher, a giant of the stage
description: The South African actor went from feeling like an impostor to becoming a giant of the British stage.

title: Moxon & Gale among 16 to leave Yorkshire
description: Director of cricket Martyn Moxon, coach Andrew Gale and all members of the coaching staff are among 16 people to leave Yorkshire amid the racism scandal.

title: Little Mix taking break after '10 amazing years'
description: The group assure fans they are not splitting up permanently and have plans for more music and tours.

title: West Side Story: Spielberg on casting the film from Latinx community

title: Grenfell Tower: Rethink deal with insulation firm, Mercedes F1 urged
description: Grenfell survivors and government minister Michael Gove criticise the F1 team over a sponsorship deal.

title: Alec Baldwin admits career could be over after fatal shooting
description: But the 63-year-old US actor says he did not pull the trigger on the set of the Rust film in October.

title: Christmas parties: Conservative staff event going ahead, says chairman
description: Tory chairman urges people to go ahead with parties - but the government faces calls for clearer guidance.

title: Rangnick says he could stay on as Man Utd boss
description: Manchester United interim boss Ralf Rangnick does not rule out staying on as manager beyond his initial six months in charge.

title: Storm Arwen: Army called in after a week without power
description: Troops will arrive in Durham later as thousands remain without electricity a week after Storm Arwen.

title: Retailers make shocking petrol profit, says RAC
description: Fuel retailers are charging unnecessarily high prices for petrol, the motoring organisation says.

title: Selfridges set for £4bn sale to Thai retail giant
description: The billionaire Weston family are close to selling the famous luxury stores chain to Central Group.

title: Gene edited sex selection may spare animal suffering
description: A gene editing technique may prevent the slaughter of animals not needed by the livestock industry.

title: Euro 2020 final disorder: Ticketless thugs 'could have caused death' at England v Italy game
description: "Ticketless, drunken and drugged-up thugs" could have caused death at the Euro 2020 final as they attempted to storm Wembley Stadium says an independent review.

title: Ros Atkins on... The No 10 Christmas party

description: The south-east London election was prompted by the death of former MP James Brokenshire.

description: Turkey's national currency has plummeted 45% against the dollar this year

description: The stories from Scotland and the north of England of those with no power a week after Storm Arwen.

title: Covid: Pfizer and Moderna jabs give best overall boost, UK trial finds
description: Researchers say there are signs the boosters would still offer protection against new variant Omicron.

title: 'You just have to say wow' - Ronaldo becomes first player to score 800 top-level goals
description: As Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo becomes the first player to 800 top-level career goals, BBC Sport hears the tributes and asks: How will he do under interim boss Ralf Rangnick?

title: The drought ravaging East African wildlife and livestock
description: At least 26 million people are struggling for food across northern Kenya, Somalia and southern Ethiopia.

title: How to spot the software that could be spying on you
